item.title: 19th Distributed Systems Paper Club
item.description: I have been organizing a distributed systems paper reading group in Berlin for the last year. We meet every other week discussing a paper in the distributed systems space. This could be anything from Chandyâ€“Lamport’s algorithm for global distributed snapshots [1] to things like conflict free replicated datatypes [2]. The event is open for anyone interested. I only ask people to come prepared. In the last meeting (19th) we covered distributed hash tables.
